title: Binnington tries to hide puck from Ovi's 900th goal

title: ‘20 years, too long!’: Lalu Prasad calls on Bihar's voters to usher in change

title: Bihar polls Phase 1: PM Modi, NDA leaders urge people to vote with full enthusiasm
content: Today Bihar celebrates the first phase of the festival of democracy. Му appeal to all voters of this phase in the assembly elections is that they should vote with full enthusiasm, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: HRD Minister Lokesh calls for complete overhaul of higher education curriculum in Andhra Pradesh

title: FIR Against Unidentified Person In Bilaspur Train Crash That Killed 11

title: India, US Discuss Bilateral Trade Engagement, Signing of 10-year Defence Deal
content: India's Ambassador to the US, Vinay Mohan Kwatra, met US Senator Steve Daines and discussed current bilateral trade engagement, signing of the 10-year defence framework agreement and opportunities for collaboration in technology.

title: No Bridge, Locals In This Bihar Town Use Boats To Reach Polling Booths
content: As voting is underway for the first phase of assembly polls in Bihar, locals of the Danapur Diara in the Patna district used boats to reach the polling stations and cast their votes for the first phase of the Bihar elections.

title: Mamata Banerjee Livid After Trinamool Mouthpiece Reports She Filled SIR Form
content: Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, embarrassed after a report in her party mouthpiece that she had filled in a form for the ongoing voter list revision exercise, has issued a flat denial.

title: In Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills, A Bypoll Has Turned Into Full-Fledged War
content: The summer has gone by, but the political temperature in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills constituency has soared.

title: 24-Year-Old Arrested After Man Dies In Hit-And-Run Case In Delhi
content: A 35-year-old man was killed in a hit-and-run incident in central Delhi, and the accused in the case has been arrested, police said on Thursday.

title: Stalker Who Shot Class 12 Student Twice Arrested, Shot In Leg By Police
content: The stalker who shot a 17-year-old girl in Faridabad after she spurned his advances has been arrested and has suffered a bullet injury in his leg in an encounter with police

title: 'RJD, Congress Have Soft Corner For Infiltrators': PM Modi In Bihar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday charged the opposition RJD-Congress combine in Bihar with having a soft corner for infiltrators, but "dislike" for Lord Ram and 'Chhathi Maiya' because of vote bank politics.

title: On Camera, Girl Returning From Coaching Shot Twice By Stalker In Faridabad
content: In a chilling stalker attack, a man opened fire on a 17-year-old girl at Ballabhgarh in Haryana's Faridabad district, about 40 km from the Delhi border. The teenager has been hospitalised, and police are looking for the shooter.

title: Delivery Boy Claims Robbery Of 14 iPhones. Turns Out He Was The Mastermind
content: A courier boy, who claimed to have been robbed of 25 mobile phones, including 14 sets of the latest iPhone 17s, at gunpoint in east Delhi's Shakarpur, turned out to be the mastermind of a staged heist, police said on Thursday.

title: Suresh Raina, Shikhar Dhawan's Assets Worth Rs 11 Crore Attached In Betting App Case
content: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has attached assets worth Rs 11.14 crore belonging to former Indian cricketers Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan in connection with the investigation into betting platforms.

title: Scolded By Father For Playing Mobile Games, Rajasthan Boy Hangs Self
content: A 13-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide by hanging himself at his home in Rajasthan's Dholpur district after being scolded by his father for playing a mobile game, police said on Thursday.

title: Who Is Larissa Nery, Brazil Model At Centre Of Rahul Gandhi's H-Bomb Row
content: Lok Sabha Leader of Opposition, Rahul Gandhi levelled fresh allegations about vote theft on Wednesday. At a press conference, he claimed that a Brazilian woman 'voted' 22 times in Haryana from 10 polling booths.

title: "Indispensable Digital Companions": Study Says 1 In 3 Indians Use Agentic AI
content: Agentic AI systems capable of interpreting human intent, making decisions, and acting autonomously are rapidly gaining traction in India, with one in three consumers (33 per cent) already using such tools.

title: Nithin Kamath Praises Groww IPO, Says 20% Applications From Zerodha Users
content: Zerodha co-founder Nithin Kamath has congratulated Lalit Keshre, the CEO of rival brokerage firm Groww, on their IPO. Kamath also said that 20 per cent of all Groww IPO applications are coming from Zerodha customers.

title: Arunachal Class 7 Student Found Dead At School Was Bullied, Says Sister
content: Days after a Class 7 student was found dead at the Sainik School in Arunachal Pradesh's East Siang district, his sister has alleged that he was tortured and bullied by seniors the night before he died.

title: Rajasthan Man With Terror Links Arrested, Was Trying To Radicalise Other Men
content: The Rajasthan Anti Terrorism Squad arrested a man, who is suspected having links with Afghan-based terrorist organisation Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan, under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act.

title: UP Woman Claims Rs 25 Lakh Insurance After Husband's Death, But He's Alive
content: A couple in Uttar Pradesh has been arrested for claiming insurance money worth Rs 25 lakh by issuing a fake death certificate to declare the husband dead.

title: 'He Threatened To Murder Me': Father Of UK's Southport Killer Who Stabbed 3
content: The father of a teenager who murdered three young girls during a stabbing spree told a UK inquiry Wednesday his "violent" son had "random" outbursts and had threatened to kill him.

title: DRI seizes ₹22 crore Alprazolam from illegal unit in Gujarat; 4 held

title: NDA stands for HIRA; Bihar witnessed tremendous growth under Modi, Nitish: BJP president Nadda

title: 'Drunk ... no, it's mahua': Bihar dy CM accuses RJD leader, gets a bizarre reply - watch
content: Bihar deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha and RJD MLC Ajay Kumar engaged in a heated exchange during the first phase of elections. Sinha alleged his convoy was attacked with cow dung, while Kumar accused Sinha of intimidating voters. Both leaders traded insults, with Sinha blaming Kumar's men for stopping their vehicle and engaging in hooliganism.

title: 'Will run bulldozer': Bihar dy CM after dung thrown at convoy; EC seeks action
content: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha accused RJD supporters of attacking his convoy and hurling stones and cow dung. He reprimanded the Lakhisarai SP, calling him "weak and cowardly" for failing to control the situation and prevent voters from exercising their franchise. The SP stated tensions arose upon Sinha's arrival.

title: Raina, Dhawan under ED lens: Rs 11.14 cr assets attached; action in money-laundering case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth over Rs 11 crore belonging to cricketers Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan in a money-laundering probe linked to the betting platform 1xBet. Investigations are examining their endorsement deals and the platform's alleged user fraud and tax evasion. The ED's crackdown targets illegal betting apps nationwide.

title: ‘China will win AI race’: Report quotes Nvidia CEO; company issues clarification
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang clarified remarks, stating China is 'nanoseconds behind America' in AI, not winning the race. He emphasized America's need to lead by engaging global developers, including those in China. Despite a US-China trade truce, President Trump indicated advanced Nvidia chips would be reserved for US companies, potentially limiting China's access to cutting-edge technology.

title: Watch: Women try to perform puja at disputed mausoleum; clash with police
content: Tension flared in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur as women attempted to offer prayers at a disputed mausoleum on Kartik Purnima. Police intervened, leading to a clash when some women tried to breach barricades. The group eventually performed prayers from a nearby lane, while authorities maintain the site's status is sub judice.

title: '8 planes shot down': Trump updates India-Pak conflict claims; adds new details
content: President Trump claimed he brokered a ceasefire between India and Pakistan by linking it to trade deals, stating they agreed to peace after he threatened tariffs.  He asserted this intervention resolved eight wars during his tenure. However, India has consistently denied any US involvement in the truce.

title: Banality of evil: German nurse kills 10 patients - to reduce workload
content: The court in Aachen called it a crime of “particular severity of guilt,” ensuring he will never walk free again. But what’s truly chilling is not just the scale of his actions — it’s their ordinariness. A man trained since 2007 to heal became, by 2024, an executioner in scrubs, armed not with malice but with indifference.

title: Microsoft research 'exposes' how AI shopping agents can be easily fooled
content: Leading AI models like GPT-4o and Gemini are surprisingly easy to trick when making purchases, a new study by Microsoft and Arizona State University reveals. Researchers found these agents struggle with too many choices and collaborating, raising doubts about their unsupervised use. This could significantly delay the envisioned future of autonomous AI agents handling complex tasks.

title: IND vs AUS: Arshdeep's catch swings momentum in India's favour - Watch
content: Arshdeep Singh's spectacular catch to dismiss Australian skipper Mitchell Marsh proved a pivotal moment in India's hard-fought victory.  The athletic grab, following a clever slower ball from Shivam Dube, broke a dangerous partnership and reignited India's control. This brilliant fielding display underscored the team's improved standards under Suryakumar Yadav's captaincy, providing a crucial spark in a low-scoring encounter.

title: Women's World Cup: Team India meets President Murmu; gifts jersey
content: The World Cup-winning Indian women's cricket team met President Droupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan, where captain Harmanpreet Kaur presented a signed team jersey. President Murmu congratulated the team on their historic achievement, emphasizing their role as inspiration and a reflection of a united India. The team also met Prime Minister Narendra Modi earlier.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University $80 million, one of the largest single donations in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation continues Scott's recent pattern of substantial gifts to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: Woman’s headless body with severed hands found floating in Noida drain
content: A headless body of a woman was discovered floating in a drain near Sector 82 on Thursday afternoon. A sweeper alerted authorities after noticing the grim discovery around noon. Police have recovered the body and are currently working to ascertain the woman's identity.

title: Ajit Pawar’s son Parth in Rs 300-cr land deal controversy: Sub-registrar suspended
content: In a shocking turn of events, a lucrative Rs 300-crore land transaction in Pune has embroiled Deputy CM Ajit Pawar's son, Parth Pawar, prompting the suspension of a sub-registrar and an extensive investigation by top officials.

title: IND A vs SA A: Jurel scores unbeaten century; rest don't cross 24 runs
content: Dhruv Jurel's unbeaten century was the highlight for India A on Day 1 against South Africa A, rescuing the team from a precarious 59/4. His resilient 132, including a vital partnership with Kuldeep Yadav, propelled India A to 255 all out. Jurel's performance underscores his growing reputation as a dependable middle-order batter.

title: ‘Haq’ movie row: HC junks plea by Shah Bano's daughter against Hashmi-starrer
content: The Madhya Pradesh high court dismissed a plea by Shah Bano Begum's daughter seeking to halt the release of the Bollywood film 'Haq'. The court found no merit in the defamation or rights violation claims, allowing the Emraan Hashmi and Yami Gautam Dhar starrer to proceed with its theatrical release.

title: ‘New scam’: Bengaluru woman exposes Rapido driver’s fake app; company suspends him
content: A Bengaluru woman has warned commuters about a new Rapido scam where drivers allegedly use fake apps to inflate fares. The driver presented a counterfeit app showing a higher charge, and the ride was not recorded on the genuine Rapido account, preventing complaints. Rapido has since suspended the driver's account.

title: ‘Perfume you can eat’: Mamdani’s 'Rajnigandha' moment just before NYC poll win— Watch
content: New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani's victory was amplified by a viral video of him casually consuming Rajnigandha, a popular Indian mouth freshener. The light-hearted clip, shared widely, resonated with Indian users who flooded social media with memes and celebratory comments, highlighting a cultural connection amidst his historic win.

title: 'New York City’s 111th mayor': Priyanka Chopra congratulates Zohran Mamdani
content: Priyanka Chopra congratulated Zohran Mamdani on Instagram for becoming New York City’s youngest and first Muslim mayor. Son of filmmaker Mira Nair, Zohran made history at 34. Priyanka moved to New York in 2016, married Nick Jonas in 2018, and they now live there with their daughter Malti Marie.

title: KGF Movie actor Harish Rai passes away at 55 after cancer battle
content: Kannada cinema mourns veteran actor Harish Rai, renowned for his impactful roles in 'Om' and the 'KGF' series, who passed away at 55 after a battle with cancer. Rai's career spanned decades, leaving a legacy of intense performances. He had previously spoken about the financial strain of his treatment, while also appreciating the support of 'KGF' star Yash.

title: 'Craziness': Brazilian 'model' reacts after Rahul's Haryana voter-fraud allegation — Watch
content: A Brazilian woman, Larissa, expressed shock after her photograph appeared multiple times in Haryana's voter list, a claim highlighted by Rahul Gandhi alleging widespread voter fraud. Gandhi presented evidence of a single foreign woman's image being used for various Indian names, questioning the integrity of the electoral rolls. The Congress leader asserted that approximately 25 lakh voter records were manipulated.

title: Gold delivers bumper gains as RBI announces SGB 2017-18 Series maturity date
content: Sovereign Gold Bonds are delivering exceptional returns, with one series, SGB 2017-18 Series VI, offering over 300% to investors. Maturing on November 6, 2025, this bond was issued at Rs 2,945 per gram (or Rs 2,895 for digital applicants) and will be redeemed at Rs 12,066 per unit, resulting in significant capital appreciation.

title: Cardiologist with 25 years of experience lists 4 lifestyle factors behind most heart issues
content: Leading cardiologist Dr. Jeremy London reveals four habits that severely damage heart health: smoking/vaping, unhealthy cholesterol, uncontrolled diabetes, and hypertension. These preventable lifestyle choices accelerate artery damage and plaque buildup, significantly increasing the risk of heart disease and stroke. Early detection and intervention are crucial for maintaining a strong cardiovascular system.

title: T20 WC: Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata & Ahmedabad could host matches; final at Modi Stadium
content: The ICC is considering a return to Tier 1 venues for the 2026 T20 World Cup, moving away from the unheralded centers used for the recent Women's World Cup. This strategic shift aims to provide a tournament of the T20 WC's magnitude with the appropriate platform. The tournament does not have an official date as yet.

title: AI to steal your job? Jamie Dimon makes this important statement amid layoff fears
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon anticipates AI will stabilize or grow the bank's workforce, focusing on efficiency gains and redeploying employees. While acknowledging AI's potential to reduce some workloads, he believes it will create new jobs in data and technology, countering widespread job loss concerns.

title: 'Won’t tolerate a Khan as Mumbai mayor': BJP neta’s warning after Mamdani’s NYC win
content: Mumbai BJP's new president, Ameet Satam, pledged to safeguard the city's identity ahead of BMC polls, prioritizing infrastructure, housing, and safety. He vowed to install a BJP mayor, citing concerns over communal division and alleged BMC corruption. Satam highlighted past development projects and promised transparency in civic governance.

title: Shutdown crisis deepens: US losing $15bn each week; 40 airports to be closed
content: America faces its longest government shutdown, crippling the economy with billions in losses weekly. Air travel is severely impacted, with flight reductions and potential chaos due to unpaid air traffic controllers. Essential services are strained, and a political deadlock persists, raising fears of escalating disruptions and permanent economic damage.

title: ‘Roti palatati rehni chahiye’: Lalu calls for ‘young govt’ in Bihar
content: As Bihar's first phase of voting commenced, RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav advocated for a "young government" led by his son Tejashwi Yadav, emphasizing the need for change after two decades. Meanwhile, Rabri Devi sharply criticized Prime Minister Modi and the BJP regarding law and order, accusing party members of violence and abduction.

title: 4 caught dumping garbage roadside in Bengaluru, woman dances in front of CCTV
content: Four individuals were caught on CCTV dumping garbage and then dancing in Mico Layout, Bengaluru. Residents expressed outrage over the disrespectful act. The offenders were identified, fined Rs 1,000 each, and authorities emphasized that civic violations are not a joke, vowing to continue night surveillance.

title: 'Aap bahut glow karte ho': Harleen stumps PM with 'skincare' googly — watch
content: Team India's Harleen Deol lightened the mood during a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi by asking about his skincare routine, leaving everyone in splits. The Prime Minister, smiling, attributed his glow to the blessings of the people. The team was celebrating their recent global title victory.

title: ‘Delivering on promises’: Mamdani names all-women team to lead his NYC transition
content: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani has appointed an all-women team to lead his transition, drawing on experience from previous administrations. Lina Khan, Elana Leopold, Melanie Hartzog, Maria Torres-Springer, and Grace Bonilla are among the key figures tasked with building a City Hall to deliver on Mamdani's campaign promises. This diverse group will help implement his vision for New York City.

title: Who was Anunay Sood? Family, net worth and more of the travel influencer who passed away at 32
content: Dubai-based travel influencer Anunay Sood, known for his stunning drone photography and adventure content, has passed away at 32 in Las Vegas. With a significant following on Instagram and YouTube, Sood was recognized by Forbes India's Top 100 Digital Stars for three consecutive years. The cause of his death remains unknown.

title: When Will Smith narrated segment of the Mahabharat, Bhagavat Gita
content: Hollywood star Will Smith revealed on Jay Shetty's podcast how he found solace in the Mahabharat's tale of Arjuna during a challenging period. Smith highlighted Arjuna's immense struggle against his own kin for kingdom and wife, emphasizing how divine guidance, with God driving his chariot, empowered the warrior against overwhelming odds. This epic continues to inspire.

title: Health risks of drinking too much water you should know
content: Drinking too much water can be dangerous, leading to hyponatraemia, a condition where dangerously low sodium levels cause cells to swell, particularly in the brain. Early signs include fatigue and headaches, escalating to confusion, seizures, and even death. Athletes and those with certain health conditions are at higher risk. Listen to your body's thirst cues to maintain safe hydration levels.

title: Chai, momos & early interviews: How Mamdani spent his 1st day as NYC Mayor-elect
content: New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, had a busy first day, marked by interviews, announcements, and meetings. A highlight was lunch with Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez at Laliguras Bistro, where they enjoyed Indian cuisine. Mamdani, a democratic socialist, secured a significant victory in the mayoral elections, defeating established political figures.

title: India starts blocking use of China-linked satellites by homegrown broadcasters
content: India is restricting satellite usage linked to Chinese entities for domestic broadcasters and teleporters, enhancing national security amid geopolitical instability. This move encourages the development of domestic satellite capabilities, with authorities denying applications from Chinese and Hong Kong-based operator.

title: 'Large plume of fire': Video shows UPS plane exploding after engine detaches in Kentucky
content: A Honolulu-bound UPS cargo plane crashed shortly after takeoff from Louisville, killing 12 people and igniting a massive fire. The MD-11 aircraft, carrying 38,000 gallons of fuel, experienced engine detachment during takeoff. The crash site, which included a petroleum recycling facility and auto parts warehouse, saw ruptured storage tanks fueling the blaze.

title: Namo No. 1! Victorious Team India presents PM Modi with a special jersey - watch
content: Fresh from their World Cup victory, Team India presented Prime Minister Narendra Modi with a special jersey. The team expressed gratitude for his encouragement, highlighting his inspirational role in their historic triumph and the progress of women in sports.

title: Joy Crizildaa hits back at Madhampatty Rangaraj’s 'Blackmail' claim
content: Fashion designer Joy Crizildaa has countered chef-actor Madhampatty Rangaraj's "blackmail" accusation by releasing a video of him speaking affectionately.  The clip, allegedly sent by Rangaraj during a trip, has ignited debate online, with many supporting Crizildaa. This development follows a Women's Commission inquiry where Rangaraj reportedly admitted to the marriage.

title: How a 'pro‑Palestinian' Zohran Mamdani became mayor of ‘Jew York’
content: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani is poised to become New York City's next mayor, challenging the city's political establishment. Despite a pro-Palestinian stance that polarized voters, Mamdani engaged with the Jewish community and resonated with younger, liberal voters prioritizing social justice and affordability, securing unexpected support.

title: 'Easier to travel to Dubai': Lack of trains derails voting plans of Bihari migrants
content: Migrant labourers from Bihar in Hyderabad face difficulties voting in state assembly elections due to a severe shortage of trains. High ticket prices and limited availability prevent many from returning home, despite their desire to participate in the electoral process for better opportunities.

title: ‘Troll sena’: PM Modi takes dig at critics who mocked Team India after early three losses - watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the Indian women's cricket team for their World Cup performance, acknowledging the trolls they faced. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur and Vice-captain Smriti Mandhana expressed how the PM's words served as significant motivation. Deepti Sharma shared her inspiration from Modi's past encouragement and her personal beliefs.

title: Watch: Armed US immigration agents drive off with toddler; father detained in raid
content: US citizen arrested near LA Home Depot, his toddler daughter transported in his car by immigration officers.  Bystanders filmed the incident, raising concerns.  The child was later reunited with family.  Officials cited the man's alleged assault and discovery of a stolen gun, but didn't explain the car transport method.

content: in 2020, opposition had won 61 of the 121 seats that go to polls in the first phase, against NDA's 59 . 'NDA Will Form Govt Again Under Nitish Kumar's leadership': Bihar Dy CM Vijay Sinha Ahead Of Polls Back then, Chirag Paswan's Lok Janshakti Party and Upendra Kushwaha had fought separately .

title: Fast break: Morant's struggles, Kuminga's breakout and more
content: we'll start with a high-altitude view of the league and zoom in on the details that matter . we have to talk about Giannis Antetokounmpo . he's averaged 34.0 points per game on 68.1% shooting through six contests .

title: NHL prospect pipeline rankings: Sharks, Islanders, then ...?
content: a player who is under 23, with less than 50 NHL games played, is eligible for this list . the rankings are done by assigning a value to each of the prospects based on their NHL projection and taking the cumulative value of each team's prospects .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Where do things stand following the first committee ranking?
content: the lone ACC team in the bracket if it were released today would be no. 14 Virginia . the ACC is already playing from behind, and it's only the first ranking of the season . teams with Would be in status below are in this week's bracket based on the committee ranking .

title: Ducks, Hawkeyes, trench football: Why you should bet the under on Oregon-Iowa
content: Oregon is 7-1 overall and 4-1 in the Big Ten, but now comes a trip to Iowa . the Hawkeyes sit at 6-2 and 4--1 in conference play, just outside the top 25 at no. 26 in the AP poll .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Champions League as it happened: Man City breeze past BVB, six goals in Brugge-Barça
content: We are back with  UEFA Champions League  action as we had some great matches on this second day of Matchday 4. Manchester City  were able to win with ease against  Borussia Dortmund  by winning 4-1 at the Etihad. It was goals galore in Belgium as  Club Brugge  and  Barcelona  played to a six-goal thriller that ended in a 3-3 draw. Also, we had  Newcastle United  beating  Athletic Club  2-0 and  Internazionale  beating  Kairat Almaty  2-1. Enjoy all the action from Wednesday's matches.

title: Women's college volleyball Bracketology: Top seedings, bracket watch and more
content: the women's college volleyball season is in the stretch run . there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the top eight teams in each region serve as first- and second-round hosts .

title: 'I've got to get my act together': Pete Carroll pushing to get Raiders on track
content: PETE CARROLL KNEW, 74, is the only one to have coached in a super bowl and national title game . they have combined for 741 wins (52 in the postseason), 20 conference championship game appearances, nine Super Bowl appearances and five Super Bowl wins . the 74-year-old has the résumé that stacks up wit .

title: Week 11 Anger Index: The case for outrage over BYU's and Miami's CFP rankings
content: the college football playoff committee has released its first top 25 ranking of the year . it's the sport's version of Walmart opening its doors at midnight on black Friday . this year, the committee has said it is considering a new "record strength" metric .

title: The Bilas Index: Jay Bilas picks his top 68 teams this season
content: the Bilas Index is the most powerful and consequential instrument of basketball wisdom and judgment known to humankind . it serves as much more than a guide or a road map to this men's college basketball season . the Bilastrator's immense and powerful brain is superior in processing basketball performance, potential and ability .

title: ⬇ Bottom 10: Georgia Tech latest to be wrecked
content: we love college football most of all for its dedication to traditions . "November Rain," guns N' Roses Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, is located in the very empty wardrobe box . a season of Auburn football penning more drama than a "General Host" season .

title: Be Nitish, Tejashwi or PK for a minute — can you win Bihar?
content: our interactive election simulator lets you run a five-step campaign of your own . in each round, you choose realistic strategies — from coalition math to messaging, crisis management, ground game and the final push . each path reshapes your approval, party cohesion and the “social fabric” score .
